Chopping Off the Beginning of a WaveTable

Sometimes a recorded waveform will have silence in front of it, or a very slow attack. This is a waste of memory and can make the instrument sound like it is responding slowly. You can "chop off" some of this beginning data.

 

 

  1. Zoom in on the beginning of a Clarinet waveform.
  2. Scroll all the way to the left.
  3. Select a short region before the waveform gets going strong. Note that when the Pitched box is unchecked then the selection will snap to the nearest zero crossing.
  4. Select "Chop before Selection" from the "Edit" menu in the wavetable window.

When you "chop" the waveform, the region to the left of selected region (A) is discarded, and the selected region (B) is faded in gradually to avoid pops.
